alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 11:47AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Wayne, Laurel, southern Owsley, western Perry, Pulaski, southern Jackson, southern Rockcastle and northern Clay Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1146 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Blake to near Cains Store. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Blake, Island City, Sturgeon, Thomas, Green Hall, Sextons Creek, Sourwood, Nathanton and Elian around 1150 AM EDT. Taff, Trixie, Teges, Felty, Ammie and Hogue around 1155 AM EDT. Mistletoe, Newfound, Oneida and Seth around 1200 PM EDT. Whoopflarea, Frazer, Brutus, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Elihu and Barcreek around 1205 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Somerset, Burnside, Saul, General Burnside S.P., Bronston, Quinton, Panco and Tateville. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 36 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 11. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 40. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
